message.content:
{"id": "122423", 
"title": "Support page range in RenderTask", 
"description": "In the RenderTask, if a page range is specified, it should be parsed and outputted one after another, with a page splitter in between, similar to the runAndRenderTask function. However, if only a single page number is set, there should only be one page outputted.

For PDF format, if a page range is specified, it should log a message saying that the range is not supported, but still output the whole report. 

For HTML format, it should support page ranges in the form of "1, 2, 510" plus the keyword "All". Invalid page numbers should be logged and an error message should be returned.", 
"OB": "For PDF format, when a page range is specified in RenderTask, log a message saying that the range is not supported, but continue to output the entire report.

For HTML format, support page ranges in the form of "1, 2, 510" plus the keyword "All". Invalid page numbers should be logged and an error message should be returned.", 
"EB": "The code should check if a page range is set in the RenderTask. If a range is specified, invalid page numbers should be logged and an error message should be returned. If neither a range nor a single page number is set, the code should default to outputting all pages, instead of giving an error message.", 
"SR": "Modify the RenderTask to include support for page ranges. The RenderTask should handle both PDF and HTML formats. For PDF, log a message if a page range is specified. For HTML, allow page ranges in the form of "1, 2, 510" plus the keyword "All". Handle invalid page numbers appropriately, logging them and returning an error message. Ensure that if no range or single page number is specified, all pages are outputted without error."}

origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '122423', 'title': 'Bug 122423Support page range in RenderTask', 'description': 'Bug 122423Support page range in RenderTask If so, parse it and form a range and output them one after another, with a page splitter in between just like the runAndRenderTask. There can only be one page in case a page number is set. ', 'OB': 'Support page range in render task.For PDF format, simply log a message saying range is not supported if a range is specified, and still output whole report.For HTML format, support page range in the form of "1,2,510" + "All". Invalid page number should be logged, and error message is returned. ', 'EB': 'The code should check if there is range set. Invalid page number should be logged, and error message is returned. If neither is set, we default to all pages, instead of the current behavior of giving an error message. ', 'SR': ''}
